taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek ambrosia , “food of the gods,” allusion unclear]

references.reference: Payne, W. W. 1964. A re-evaluation of the genus Ambrosia (Compositae). J. Arnold Arbor. 45: 401–430.
Peterson, K. M. and W. W. Payne. 1973. The genus Hymenoclea (Compositae: Ambrosieae). Brittonia 25: 243–256.
Strother, J. L. and B. G. Baldwin. 2002. Hymenocleas are ambrosias (Compositae). Madroño 49: 143–144.

key_statement.description: Shrubs.
Leaf blades and/or lobes filiform (0.5–1.5 mm wide); burs winged, wings 5–20+, oblanceolate to cuneiform or flabellate to orbiculate.
Wings on burs mostly around middles, 2–3 × 1–2 mm; flowering (May–)Aug–Nov
Wings on burs ± scattered, 3–4(–6) × 2–4(–8) mm; flowering Mar–May(–Jun)

Leaf blades and/or lobes mostly deltate, elliptic, lanceolate, ovate, rhombic, or triangular (broader than filiform); burs spiny, spines 8–30(–80+), ± lanceolate (sometimes navicular at bases) to subulate or acerose (tips sometimes uncinate).
Leaf blades (green) hirsutulous to hirtellous abaxially.
Leaves: petioles 0–2 mm, blades elliptic to ovate, margins spiny-toothed
Leaves: petioles 10–35 mm, blades lanceolate to narrowly triangular, margins coarsely toothed (not spiny)
Leaf blades (often gray, silvery, or white) ± densely pilosulous, puberulent, scabrellous, strigillose, or tomentulose abaxially.
Leaf blades (1–)2–3-pinnately lobed; pistillate heads often intermixed with staminates
Leaf blades not pinnately lobed (irregularly toothed to ± laciniate in A. eriocentra ); pistillate heads proximal to staminates.
Leaf blades elliptic, lance-linear, or rhombic (margins irregularly toothed to ± laciniate); pistillate florets 1; burs densely villous and stipitate-glandular
Leaf blades deltate, lance-deltate, ovate, or rounded-deltate; pistillate florets (1–)2(–3); burs puberulent to tomentulose and/or ± stipitate-glandular.
Leaf blades: bases cordate to truncate, abaxial faces densely puberulent (including veins)
Leaf blades: bases cuneate to truncate, abaxial faces tomentulose (mostly between veins).
Leaf blades ovate to rounded-deltate; burs usually tomentulose (little, if at all, stipitate-glandular)
Leaf blades deltate to lance-deltate; burs usually stipitate-glandular (little, if at all, tomentulose)
Annuals, perennials, or subshrubs (usually rhizomatous).
Annuals.
Leaves mostly opposite (usually some blades palmately 3–5-lobed)
Leaves mostly opposite (in A. bidentata , opposite and alternate, or mostly alternate, usually some or all blades 1–2-pinnately lobed, except in A. bidentata with 0–4 basal lobes).
Leaf blades with (1–)2(–4) basal lobes or not lobed; peduncles of staminate heads 0–0.5 mm; burs 5–8 mm
Leaf blades mostly 1–2-pinnately lobed; peduncles of staminate heads 0.5–2 mm; burs 2–5 mm.
Involucres of staminate heads (2–)3–5(–7) mm diam. (usually each with 1–5+ black nerves); burs ± fusiform to obpyramidal, 3–5 mm, spines 8–18+, 2–4(–5) mm
Involucres of staminate heads 2–3+ mm diam. (usually without black nerves); burs ± globose to pyriform, 2–3 mm, spines or tubercles 3–5+, 0.1–0.5+ mm
Perennials or subshrubs.
Stems ± prostrate or decumbent (usually beaches or strand).
Staminate involucres 2–3+ mm diam.; burs ± pyriform, 1–2 mm, spines or tubercles 0–5+, 0.1–0.5+ mm
Staminate involucres 4–6+ mm diam.; burs fusiform to ± pyriform, 4–7+ mm, spines 8–16+, 0.5–1.5+ mm
Stems ± erect (rarely beaches or strand).
Leaf blades sometimes 1–2(–3)-pinnately lobed (if lobed, lobes mostly deltate to lanceolate); involucres of staminate heads usually ± saucer-shaped (cup-shaped in A. cheiranthifolia from s Texas).
Leaf blades elliptic to lance-elliptic, 50–80(–180) × 12–20(–50+) mm, 1–2(–3)-pinnately lobed (lobes ± deltate), abaxial faces densely finely scabrellous
Leaf blades elliptic, lanceolate, oblanceolate, oblong, or ovate, 20–60(–100+) × 8–45(–75+) mm, 1(–2)-pinnately lobed or not lobed, abaxial faces densely sericeous, strigillose, or strigose.
Leaves: petioles none, blades lanceolate or lance-elliptic to lance-oblong or oblanceolate, 20–50(–70+) mm, rarely ± pinnately lobed (lobes ± deltate)
Leaves: petioles 10–45+ mm, blades elliptic to ovate, 45–60(–100+) mm, usually 1–2-pinnately lobed (lobes ± lanceolate)
Leaf blades usually 1–4-pinnately lobed (lobes or non-lobed blades mostly lanceolate to linear); involucres of staminate heads cup-shaped.
Burs: spines (1–)8–13+, subulate, tips usually uncinate.
Leaf blades mostly linear (some 1-pinnate, lobes linear); involucres of staminate heads 4–6+ mm diam
Leaf blades lanceolate to ovate, laciniately 2–4-pinnately lobed (lobes ± lanceolate); involucres of staminate heads 1.5–3+ mm diam
Burs: spines or tubercles 0 or 1–6, stoutly conic to ± acerose, tips straight.
Leaf blades deltate to elliptic, 15–35(–75) × 12–25(–45) mm, laciniately (1–)2(–3)-pinnately lobed; burs ± fusiform, 2–2.5 mm, strigillose
Leaf blades deltate to lanceolate, 20–60(–140) × 8–35(–50+) mm, pinnately toothed or 1(–2)-pinnately lobed; burs ± obpyramidal to globose, 2–3 mm, hirsutulous
